results.title: Applause! Georgette Mcgregor's seven steps to effective spee
results.brief_description: Fred Holliday and Georgette McGregor discuss techniques necessary for effective speech. Actors demonstrate these techniques. No other credits available.

results.title: Appearance
results.brief_description: Few of us are happy about the way we look. We are either too short or too fat; our noses are too big or the wrong shape. As more people resort to surgery to alter appearance, this program talks to people about what they’ve done and the effect that it has had on their lives.

results.title: Apollo 17: on the shoulder of giants
results.creator_credit: Don Wiseman and A V Corporation
results.brief_description: A record of the final manned flight to the moon in the Apollo series, this film shows the astronauts, Eugene Cernan, Harrison E. Schmit and Ronald E. Evans - one of them in this case, a geologist - examining the moon’s surface, probing it and collecting samples and setting up various testing apparatus. With clearer photography than seen in earlier films, there are some excellent views of both the earth and the moon recorded from space. Also includes intercuts of Skylab, the 1975 Apollo-Soyuz co-operative and the space shuttle.The sub title derives from a saying of Sir Isaac Newton, who, when his work was praised, modestly replied that his achievement was due to the fact that he was carried to his goal on the shoulders of giants.

results.title: Apollo 11: one giant leap for mankind
results.brief_description: Follows the flight of Apollo 11 to the Moon and back, showing the launching and each stage of the operation with views and comments of the astronauts, their activities on the surface and return trip to President Nixon’s welcome No other credits available

results.title: Apollo 10: prelude to the moon landing
results.brief_description: Depicts the “dress rehearsal” of the Apollo 11 flight with astronauts Stafford, Young and Cernan. This mission supplied information to assist the Apollo 11 moon landing and the film contains the first colour television shot in space and shows the spacecraft nine miles from the lunar surface.

results.title: Aplekage: the art of Stewart Merrett
results.creator_credit: Russell Hurley, Trevor George Lucas, Andromeda Productions and Dunkirk Traders
results.brief_description: Stewart Merrett works in a fabric art form that is colourful, understandable and very popular. He likes to think that people who call themselves artists can actually draw, that they have some intrinsic craft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russell Hurley, Trevor George Lucas, Andromeda Productions and Dunkirk Traders

results.title: Aphids
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Deals with periods in the life-history of the common plant louse; close-ups show the insect laying eggs, moulting and feeding. A time-lapse study is used to show wing development; microcinematography shows details of the insect’s beck.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films

results.title: Apemen of Africa
results.brief_description: The processes involved in pinpointing the appearance of humans on earth are discussed in this film. Fossils discovered in South Africa in 1924 bore evidence that humans first appeared in Africa, not Asia, contrary to prevailing scientific opinion. Shows how further discoveries by anthropologists proved without doubt the existence of a human-like creature who lived in Africa as long as three and a half million years ago. Narrated by E. G. Marshall
